page.title: 11CHALFONT AREA RELIGION
page.content: JORDANS {MEETING HOUSE} This most famous {Meeting House}, built 1688, seats 200 worshippers, 32 local families participating regularly. It receives many American visitors as its {QUAKER} BURIAL GROUND contains the remains of {WILLIAM PENN},his 2 wives and 10 of his 16 children and is still used for interments from Hampstead and Westminster Meetings. OLD JORDAN HOSTEL is a non-sectarian guesthouse for 40 administered by The Society of Friends. Originally a farmhouse where {Quaker} Meetings were held from 1659 it contains a priest-hole. The stables were converted to a Refectory Annexe in 1910 with 2 flats and a gardener's cottage. The grounds contain the 17th Century Mayflower Barn with some timbers said to have come from the Pilgrim Fathers' ship. Primarily a concert hall, it has many other uses.
